result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew V. Krumrey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant to sign up for Probation before he leaves today.
If everything is going well Court may terminate Probation early.
Court notes 264 days credit if revoked.

 
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
Payments on this case to commence August 1, 2018 at $50.00 per month with the Clerk of Court.
DNA surcharge.

-Any other programming the Agent may recommend.
-Defendant to report to the Day Report Center to provide a DNA sample.

DE called to ck the status of his Pymt Plan & inquire when his 1st pymt is due.  DE was advised that his 1st pymt was due 2-10-19 & his debt has since been turned over to Coll (SDC).  DE was advised that he would have been sent notice of this, but his mail has been ret'd.  I inquired if the DE has moved since his last address change in Dec 2018 & he stated he has not, but likely hasn't checked or opened his mail.  DE was given the phone # for SDC & advised to call them to make pymts.  Includes 10CF212, 13CF245, 14CF229, 16CF46.  jaf

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Edward Minser, NONA by def. Case called at 9:16. Scheduled for a motion to revoke hearing. Court reviews file. Court concludes there has been a violation of the agreement. State has filed a copy of the motion to DE on 07-06-2017. Court accepts offer of proof. On motion of the State Court will revoke agreement and enters the judgment of conviction for felony bail jumping and authorizes a Warrant. ADA Minser updates the court as to 16CF46. Court notes condition in 16CF46, Court will lift the stay and authorize 30 days St. Croix County Jail.
Motion to Revoke Deferred Judgment of Conviction filed by ADA Minser. RJG
paper file destroyed 2/16/18. eif
dated 7-21-16 from Sun Monitoring stating that the def has completed his 90 days electronic monitoring. Reviewed by court. JA c: DA & Def Atty. mw

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Fox, ADA:  Edward Minser, DF ATTY:  Joseph Robert Caton, DF:  Andrew Vernon Krumrey appeared. Includes 14CF229 - MH and 16CF46 - Pleah. Cases called at 8:45 pm. Court notes that there is a pending motion to revoke DP agreement in case 14CF229. Parties set to plea to 16CF46. ADA Minser moves to amend 16CF46 to MISDEMEANOR 946.425(1m)(a) - Failure to report. Court amends and reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads guilty to the AMENDED Ct 1 in 16CF46. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly/intelligently waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of the Amended Ct 1 in 16CF46. Sentencing recommendations. Defendant files letter for Court to review. Court summarizes letter and orders: 
- 30 IMPOSED / STAYED days in SCC Jail with the condition of successful completion of agreement in 14CF229. 
- $243.00 in Court costs
- $200.00 DNA surcharge and sample
Court orders defendant on a payment plan of $25.00 per month to begin January 1, 2017.

RE: 14CF229 - ADA Minser withdraws motion to revoke agreement. Agreement to continue in current status until 7/7/17. Diversion Coordinator to provide quarterly updates.

ADA Hartung requests to reserve on the motion today. DE is going to serve jail all at one time instead of intermittently. Court accepts admin. transfer of the 16CF46. Bond continues.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 2, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Lundell makes statement.  E. Lundell asks the court to take Judicial Notice of the physical file 13CF245 and the Search Warrant 13SW86 in that file.  Plaintiff's Ex. 1 (Summary of damages) O/R. Attorney O'Boyle makes arguments.  Court finds that E. Lundell took reasonable precautions as a landlord due to the DE being charged with drug trafficking and awards judgment of $3,586.19 joint and several to Jessica Lynn Viellieu.  Victim Witness will draft Restitution Worksheet.  Court adjourned at 2:31 p.m.  lw

AODA and follow any recommended treatment.Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Scobey. ADA:  Amber L Hahn   DF ATTY:  John M O'Boyle   DF:  Andrew V. Krumrey appeared. Includes 13CF245 and 14CF229. Cases called at 8:11 a.m. Set for plea. ADA Hahn informs Crt of agreement. DE pleads guilty to Ct 1 in 13CF245 and guilty to 14CF229. DE sworn. Crt informs DE of rights. Attorneys stipulate to the facts. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly makes plea. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 in 13CF245. Crt finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of 14CF229 and withholds entry of judgment in favor of DJOC. Attorneys are not requesting a PSI.  Crt reserves on PSI. ADA Hahn states a restitution hearing will be requested. Recommendations. DE makes statement. Court orders:  Sentence:  W/H, 3 years probation with conditions. Conditions of probation are:

-6 months jail. 3 months stayed. DE to serve 30 days each year of probation.
-Huber for work/seek work.
-AODA and follow any recommended treatment.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.  
-DE subject to random and regular testing.
-Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
-No contact with 880 E 6th St, New Richmond, WI
-Court costs and supervision costs. Payable through probation.
-Maintain full time employment or full time education.
-No contact with Jessica Viellieu.

Crt authorizes restitution. Crt authorizes electronic monitoring. Crt notes 31 days credit against ultimate sentence. DE to report to probation today. DE to meet with Diversion Coordinator today.
